column4: I'm sorry for being so noob, but my computer won't jump to the regular ubuntu sign-in screen, so I alt-ctrl F2 and login in there, then I try to do a gnome-session, or use mplayer, or any of that, I get an error saying "Cannot open display"... what is my problem, just so I know where to start digging
what have you done befor this happend?
let my friend do some stuff to the server and he communicated with it headlessly =( I know don't let other poele do stuff without knowing what they are doing exactly.  He upgraded from 9.10 to 10.04
have you played with graphics settings? Try to rename "/etc/X11/xorg.conf" to "xorg.conf.old"
let my friend do some stuff to the server and he communicated with it headlessly =( I know don't let other poele do stuff without knowing what they are doing exactly.  He upgraded from 9.10 to 10.04
so do that and restart?
yes try it with restart
if that doesn't do the job rename it back and follow soreau's instructions or do "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
I just rebooted the computer, just to be clear, your initial suggestion is to "mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.old" and then restart, and let the system make a new one?
yes, and it doesn't make a new one
only if it the gdm isn't comiong up again, try "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
In my case I could only start gdm if I hadn't any xorg.conf :)
well it's an even worse problem because whenever I start the computer, half the time I jsut get some text at the top flashing and being weird... I smell a reformat coming up =(
maybe it's a good time to make a backup of /home and /etc now ,)
lol, it's okay, it's a "toy" computer, making it an htpc, this is my last shot before the dreaded reformat
so go for Oneiric then ,)
wanna, but I have a fitpc2 and the only support they have for how to compile mplayer with video acceleration is using 9.10
is that your problem? http://bit.ly/swXDkh
are you asking if that's the problem with me running oneirc?
also, I did the xorg move and now I get a big black screen...
but you can switch to cli?!
